results.title: Jacquot de Nantes [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: This moving homage to filmmaker Jacques Demy (‘Lola’, ‘The Umbrellas of Cherbourg’, ‘The Young girls of Rochefort’), by his wife, filmmaker Agnes Varda, was made with his collaboration but completed after his death in 1990. Scenes enacted from his idyllically happy childhood filmed at the actual locations in his hometown of Nantes, are intercut with Demy’s home movies, his recollections and clips from his films. The film presents an evocative chronicle of the teenage Jacquot’s growing fascination with the cinema culminating in his departure for film school in Paris. Cast includes Philippe Maron, Edouard Joubeaud and Laurent Monnier. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Jackie Brown [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Band Apart, Mighty Mighty Afrodite Productions, Lawrence Bender and Quentin Tarantino
results.brief_description: Ruthless arms dealer Ordell Robbie (Samuel L. Jackson), who lives with perpetually stoned beach-babe Melanie (Bridget Fonda), teams with his old buddy Louis Gara (Robert De Niro), just released from prison after serving four years for armed robbery. ATF agent Ray Nicolette (Michael Keaton), and cop Mark Dargus (Michael Bowen), bust stewardess Jackie Brown (Pam Grier), who was smuggling money into the country for Ordell. Ordell springs Jackie, but when middle-aged bail bondsman Max Cherry (Robert Forster) picks her up at the jail, he’s attracted to her, and they choose a romantic route with detours. Mistrust and suspicions surface after Jackie pits Ordell and the cops against each other, convincing Ordell that she’s going to double-cross the cops. Adapted from Elmore Leonard’s novel “Rum Punch”, “Jackie Brown” is Tarantino’s homage to Blaxploitation cinema of the 1970s and a tribute to one of its feistiest characters - Pam Grier.

results.title: Jack's back
results.creator_credit: Palisades Entertainment Group, Tim Moore, Cassian Elwes and Rowdy Herrington
results.brief_description: It is August 1988, one hundred years since Jack the Ripper committed his brutal murders in the East End of London and now Los Angeles finds itself experiencing that very same fear as a copy-cat “Jack the Ripper” is on the loose, stalking the streets and murdering his prostitute victims in the same cold and calculated manner as his predecessor one hundred years ago. However in this tale, there is an unusual twist to the plot involving a young physician (James Spader) and his twin brother. Cast includes Cynthia Gibb, Jim Haynie, Robert Picardo and Rod Loomis.

results.title: Jabberwocky
results.creator_credit: Umbrella Entertainment, Sandy Lieberson and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: A Monty Python splinter faction is responsible for this medieval farce of hysterical proportions. Based on the Lewis Carroll play of the same name, the monster of the title doesn’t appear until the final minutes but it is worth the wait as it is a work of inspired dark imagination. Set in the Middle Ages in England, Michael Palin plays a bumpkin son of a country cooper who goes to the city to seek his fortune after the death of his father. The land in which he lives is terrorised by the monster who attacks travellers who pass through it’s forest. Palin becomes the inadvertent hero, chosen to slay the monster and win the hand of the fair princess. Full of dark humour and even darker ambience, this is not a film for the squeamish!

results.title: Italian for beginners = Italiensk for begyndere
results.creator_credit: Danish Film Institute, Danish Radio-TV, Zentropa, Ib Tardini and Lone Scherfig
results.brief_description: Adhering to the Dogme 95 manifesto, signed by a group of like-minded Danish filmmakers committed to an independent film practice that wishes to see cinema become again an innovative, experimental and politically subversive art, “Italian for beginners” is the first comedy Dogme film to emerge. The narrative revolves around the fortunes of several Danes living near Copenhagen. These consist of: Andreas, a lonely new priest; Olympia, a clumsy pastry-shop assistant coping with an abusive and mentally unstable father; Karen, a hairdresser who has to fend off her alcoholic brain-damaged mother; Hal-Finn, a cafe manager with anger management issues; Jorgen, a loyal friend of Hal-Finn’s who forms a crush on Italian waitress, Guilia. These protagonists slowly overcome their woes and form meaningful relationships with each other, creating a mini-network of support, whilst also discovering several existing strains of interconnectedness. Written and directed by Lone Scherfig, “Italian for beginners” makes the most of its simple premise whilst gently probing the themes of family, relationships, love and romance, through a perspective that presages the absurdity of life. A thoroughly enjoyable lightweight addition to the rather grave Dogme canon. Cast includes Anders W. Berthelsen, Anette Stovelbaek, Ann Eleonora Jorgensen, Peter Gantzler, Lars Kaalund and Sara Indrio Jensen.

results.title: It happened one night [DVD]
results.brief_description: Clark Gable and Claudette Colbert team up as mismatched lovers in this comedy classic. Spoiled Ellie Andrews escapes from her millionaire father who wants to stop her from marrying a worthless playboy. En route to New York, Ellie gets involved with an out-of-work newsman, Peter Warner. When their bus breaks down, the bickering couple set off on a madcap hitch-hiking expedition. Peter hopes to make a story out of their misadventures but complications set in when the runaway heiress and brash reporter fall in love. Screenplay by Robert Riskin based on the short story Samuel Hopkins Adams.

results.title: It happened at the world's fair
results.creator_credit: Turner Entertainment, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Ted Richmond and Norman Taurog
results.brief_description: Friends and pilots Mike Edwards (Elvis Presley) and Danny Burke (Gary Lockwood) find themselves hitchhiking a ride with a Chinese farmer and his niece who are on their way to the World Fair in Seattle. They leave in their wake creditors, the welfare board, smugglers and a gangster, while still finding time to woo women, gamble and croon along the way. Although this is not one of Elvis’ best features, it still includes a few memorable songs such as “One broken heart for sale”, “How would you like to be” and “Take me to the fair”. Cast also includes Joan O’Brien.

results.title: It's a wonderful life [DVD]
results.brief_description: The philanthropic director of a small savings and loan association on the verge of bankruptcy in a small American town thinks he is a failure and contemplates suicide. His guardian angel attempts to convince him that his life has been far from worthless. A comedy-drama in a fantasy framework which recapitulates Capra’s major themes: the fragility of good and virtue and the ever threatening encroachment of evil. (Awards: nominated for five Oscars, including Best Picture, Best Director and Best Actor).

results.title: It's a very merry Muppet Christmas movie
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, National Broadcasting Company, Jim Henson, Martin G. Baker, Warren Carr and Kirk Thatcher
results.brief_description: It’s the night before Christmas and the Muppet Theatre is under threat of being demolished. Stars the usual Muppet gang of Miss Piggy, Kermit and others, who all rally and with some divine intervention and funny send-ups of holiday movie cliches, to reveal the film’s message is love will save the day (as well as a good song and dance number!). Humans that also feature are David Arquette, Joan Cusack and Whoopi Goldberg. Directed by Kirk R Thatcher and produced by Martin G Baker and Warren Carr.
